what: Carbon Flux Partitioning Methods by the Malone Disturbance Ecology Lab
title: Carbon Flux Partitioning Methods by the Malone Disturbance Ecology Lab
text: Ecosystem CO2 Flux Partitioning (EC flux partitioning) methods used estimate total carbon flux ecosystem atmosphere divided among different processes, photosynthesis (carbon uptake) respiration (carbon release). methods important understanding carbon balance ecosystems. Flux partitioning methods can use light response curve (LRC). can use daytime NEE (NEEday) tower sites fit LRCs nighttime NEE (NEEnight) estimate ecosystem respiration temperature response curves (TRC) night. common methods partitioning carbon fluxes:

title: Carbon Flux Partitioning Methods by the Malone Disturbance Ecology Lab
text: can install development version CarbonExchangeParameters GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Malone-Disturbance-Ecology-Lab/CarbonExchangeParameters")

what: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_01
title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_01
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim \frac{a_1 \cdot \text{PAR} \cdot a_x}{a_1 \cdot \text{PAR} + a_x} - r$$ \(r\) ecosystem respiration (\(\mu\)mol CO2 m-2 s-1), \(a_1\) apparent quantum efficiency CO2 uptake (CO2), \(a_x\) maximum CO2 uptake rate ecosystem scale. equation requires photosynthetically active radiation, PAR, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1 net ecosystem exchange, NEE, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_01
code: LRC_PARMS_01(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.lrc = brms::prior("normal(-0.01, 0.1)", nlpar = "a1", lb = -0.2, ub = 0) +     brms::prior("normal(-7.65, 0.33)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -30, ub = -0.01) +     brms::prior("normal(2.10, 0.11)", nlpar = "r", lb = 1.9, ub = 2.2),   idx.colname = NULL,   NEE.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_01
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.lrc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. NEE.colname (character) name column containing NEE. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR.
code: brms::prior("normal(-0.01, 0.1)", nlpar = "a1", lb = -0.2, ub = 0) + brms::prior("normal(-7.65, 0.33)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -30, ub = -0.01) + brms::prior("normal(2.10, 0.11)", nlpar = "r", lb = 1.9, ub = 2.2)

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_01
text: (dataframe) Dataframe parameter values index used fit .

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_01
text: Model parameters fit using R package brms. Rhat (Potential Scale Reduction Factor): Indicates well different Markov chains analysis converged posterior distribution. Ideally, Rhat close 1 parameters. high Rhat value suggests potential convergence issues need run chains longer. Bulk ESS (Effective Sample Size - Bulk): Estimates effective number independent samples central part posterior distribution. Tail ESS (Effective Sample Size - Tail): Estimates effective number independent samples tails posterior distribution. Important assessing reliability quantile estimates (e.g., 95% confidence intervals). Key points remember: Aim Rhat close 1 high values Bulk ESS Tail ESS.

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_01
code: tower.data <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "AMF_US-Skr_BASE_HH_2-5_Formatted.csv", package = "CarbonExchangeParameters"))  Example_LRC_PARMS_01 <- LRC_PARMS_01(data.frame = tower.data,                                     iterations = 1000,                                     priors.lrc = brms::prior("normal(-0.01, 0.1)", nlpar = "a1", lb = -0.2, ub = 0) +                                       brms::prior("normal(-7.65, 0.33)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -30, ub = -0.01) +                                       brms::prior("normal(2.10, 0.11)", nlpar = "r", lb = 1.9, ub = 2.2),                                     idx.colname = 'YearMon',                                     NEE.colname = 'NEE_PI',                                     PAR.colname = 'SW_IN') #> [1] "GREAT JOB! your dataframe contains idx" #> [1] "YIPEE! your dataframe contains nee" #> [1] "Hooray! your dataframe contains PAR" #> Your dataframe looks good and you are now ready to start fitting models #> [1] "2004-07" #> Error : CmdStan path has not been set yet. See ?set_cmdstan_path. #> Error in LRC_PARMS_01(data.frame = tower.data, iterations = 1000, priors.lrc = brms::prior("normal(-0.01, 0.1)",     nlpar = "a1", lb = -0.2, ub = 0) + brms::prior("normal(-7.65, 0.33)",     nlpar = "ax", lb = -30, ub = -0.01) + brms::prior("normal(2.10, 0.11)",     nlpar = "r", lb = 1.9, ub = 2.2), idx.colname = "YearMon",     NEE.colname = "NEE_PI", PAR.colname = "SW_IN"): object 'model.brms' not found

what: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_02
title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_02
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim \frac{a_1 \cdot \text{PAR} + a_x - \sqrt{(a_1 \cdot \text{PAR} + a_x)^2 - 4 \cdot \text{PAR} \cdot a_1 \cdot a_x}}{2 \cdot \Theta} - r$$ \(r\) ecosystem respiration (\(\mu\)mol CO2 m-2 s-1), \(a_1\) apparent quantum efficiency CO2 uptake (CO2), \(\Theta\) convexity (curvilinear angle) nonrectangular hyperbola (degrees) \(a_x\) maximum CO2 uptake rate ecosystem scale. equation requires photosynthetically active radiation, PAR, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1 net ecosystem exchange, NEE, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_02
code: LRC_PARMS_02(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.lrc = brms::prior("normal(-0.01, 0.1)", nlpar = "a1", lb = -0.2, ub = 0) +     brms::prior("normal(-7.65, 0.33)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -30, ub = -5) +     brms::prior("normal(2.10, 0.11)", nlpar = "r", lb = 1.9, ub = 2.2) +     brms::prior("normal(25, 25)", nlpar = "theta", lb = 0, ub = 3),   idx.colname = NULL,   NEE.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_02
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.lrc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. NEE.colname (character) name column containing NEE. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR.
code: brms::prior("normal(-0.01, 0.1)", nlpar = "a1", lb = -0.2, ub = 0) + brms::prior("normal(-7.65, 0.33)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -30, ub = -5) + brms::prior("normal(2.10, 0.11)", nlpar = "r", lb = 1.9, ub = 2.2)+ brms::prior("normal(25, 25)", nlpar = "theta", lb = 0, ub = 3)

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_02
text: Model parameters fit using R package brms. Rhat (Potential Scale Reduction Factor): Indicates well different Markov chains analysis converged posterior distribution. Ideally, Rhat close 1 parameters. high Rhat value suggests potential convergence issues need run chains longer. Bulk ESS (Effective Sample Size - Bulk): Estimates effective number independent samples central part posterior distribution. Tail ESS (Effective Sample Size - Tail): Estimates effective number independent samples tails posterior distribution. Important assessing reliability quantile estimates (e.g., 95% confidence intervals). Key points remember: Aim Rhat close 1 high values Bulk ESS Tail ESS.

what: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_03
title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_03
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim a_x \left( 1 - \exp \left( -\frac{a_1 \cdot \text{PAR}}{a_x} \right) \right) - r$$ NEE net ecosystem exchange \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1, \(a_x\) light-saturated net photosynthetic rate, \(a_1\) initial quantum efficiency intrinsic quantum yield, PAR Photosynthetically active radiation \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1, \(r\) dark respiration rate. equation requires photosynthetically active radiation, PAR, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1 net ecosystem exchange, NEE, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1. Reference: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12010-015-1543-0. Equation # 8 paper (reference).

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_03
code: LRC_PARMS_03(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.lrc = brms::prior("normal(-9.9, 0.4)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -15, ub = 1) +     brms::prior("normal(-0.05, 0.1)", nlpar = "a1", lb = -0.2, ub = 0.5) +     brms::prior("normal(1.2, 0.11)", nlpar = "r", lb = 1, ub = 3.2),   idx.colname = NULL,   NEE.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_03
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.lrc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. NEE.colname (character) name column containing NEE. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR.
code: brms::prior("normal(-9.9, 0.4)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -15, ub = 1) + brms::prior("normal(-0.05, 0.1)", nlpar = "a1", lb = -0.2, ub = 0.5) + brms::prior("normal(1.2, 0.11)", nlpar = "r", lb = 1.0, ub = 3.2)

what: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_04
title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_04
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim a_1 \left(\frac{1-b \cdot \text{PAR}}{1 + \frac{a_1}{a_x} \cdot \text{PAR}} \right) \cdot \text{PAR} - r$$ \(r\) ecosystem respiration (\(\mu\)mol CO2 m-2 s-1), \(a_1\) apparent quantum efficiency CO2 uptake (CO2), \(b\) photoinhibitation correction factor, \(a_x\) maximum CO2 uptake rate ecosystem scale. equation requires photosynthetically active radiation, PAR, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1 net ecosystem exchange, NEE, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_04
code: LRC_PARMS_04(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.lrc = brms::prior("normal(-0.01, 0.1)", nlpar = "a1", lb = -0.2, ub = 0) +     brms::prior("normal(-7.65, 0.33)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -30, ub = -5) +     brms::prior("normal(2.10, 0.11)", nlpar = "r", lb = 1.9, ub = 2.2) +     brms::prior("normal(.3, .2)", nlpar = "b", lb = 0, ub = 3),   idx.colname = NULL,   NEE.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_04
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.lrc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. NEE.colname (character) name column containing NEE. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR.
code: brms::prior("normal(-0.01, 0.1)", nlpar = "a1", lb = -0.2, ub = 0) + brms::prior("normal(-7.65, 0.33)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -30, ub = -5) + brms::prior("normal(2.10, 0.11)", nlpar = "r", lb = 1.9, ub = 2.2) + brms::prior("normal(.3, .2)", nlpar = "b", lb = 0, ub= 3)

what: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_05
title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_05
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim -a_1 \cdot \exp(-B \cdot \text{PAR}) - Y \cdot \exp(Z \cdot \text{PAR})$$ B Y correction factors B photoinhibitation item, Y light saturation item Y = /Pmax, Z correction factor well defined within paper. equation requires photosynthetically active radiation, PAR, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1 net ecosystem exchange, NEE, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_05
code: LRC_PARMS_05(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.lrc = brms::prior("normal(-0.12, 0.1)", nlpar = "a", lb = -0.2, ub = 0) +     brms::prior("normal(0, 1)", nlpar = "B", lb = -1, ub = 1) +     brms::prior("normal(0.2, 0.1)", nlpar = "Y", lb = 0, ub = 0.3) +     brms::prior("normal(0.0, 0.1)", nlpar = "Z", lb = -0.1, ub = 0.2),   idx = NULL,   nee = NULL,   PAR = NULL )

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_05
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.lrc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx (character) name column containing index. nee (character) name column containing NEE. PAR (character) name column containing PAR.
code: brms::prior("normal(-0.12, 0.1)", nlpar = "a", lb = -0.2, ub = 0) + brms::prior("normal(0, 1)", nlpar = "B", lb = -1, ub = 1) + brms::prior("normal(0.2, 0.1)", nlpar = "Y", lb = 0, ub = 0.3) + brms::prior("normal(0.0, 0.1)", nlpar = "Z", lb = -0.1, ub = 0.2)

what: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_06
title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_06
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim a_x \left( 1 - \exp \left( a_1 \cdot \left( \text{PAR} - I_{\text{comp}} \right) \right) \right)$$ NEE daytime net ecosystem exchange (\(\mu\)mol CO2 m-2 s-1), \(a_x\) maximum photosynthesis rate (\(\mu\)mol CO2 m-2 s-1), \(a_1\) coefficient, \(I_{\text{comp}}\) compensation light level unit PAR. equation requires photosynthetically active radiation, PAR, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1 net ecosystem exchange, NEE, \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_06
code: LRC_PARMS_06(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.lrc = brms::prior("normal(-5, 5)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -30, ub = 0) +     brms::prior("normal(0.1, 1)", nlpar = "alpha", lb = 0, ub = 1) +     brms::prior("normal(300, 100)", nlpar = "Icomp", lb = 0, ub = 500),   idx.colname = NULL,   NEE.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Light Response Curve (LRC) by an index to get a parameter file — LRC_PARMS_06
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.lrc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. NEE.colname (character) name column containing NEE. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR.
code: brms::prior("normal(-5, 5)", nlpar = "ax", lb = -30, ub = 0) + brms::prior("normal(0.1, 1)", nlpar = "alpha", lb = 0, ub = 1) + brms::prior("normal(300, 100)", nlpar = "Icomp", lb = 0, ub = 500)

what: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_01
title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_01
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim r_b \cdot \exp \left( E_0 \left( \left( \frac{1}{T_{\text{ref}} - T_0} \right) - \left( \frac{1}{T_{\text{air}} - T_0} \right) \right) \right)$$ equation requires air temperature (TA) degrees Celsius, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1, net ecosystem exchange (NEE) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_01
code: TRC_PARMS_01(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.trc = brms::prior("normal(0.5, 0.3)", nlpar = "E0", lb = 0.01, ub = 1) +     brms::prior("normal(1.0, 0.3)", nlpar = "Rref", lb = 0.01, ub = 1),   idx.colname = NULL,   nee.colname = NULL,   TA.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_01
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, air temperature (TA), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.trc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. nee.colname (character) name column containing NEE. TA.colname (character) name column containing air temperature. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR.
code: brms::prior("normal(0.5, 0.3)", nlpar = "E0", lb = 0.01, ub = 1) + brms::prior("normal(1.0, 0.3)", nlpar = "Rref", lb = 0.01, ub = 1)

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_01
text: (dataframe) Dataframe parameter values index used fit .

what: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_02
title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_02
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim r_0 \cdot \exp \left( \alpha \cdot T + \beta \cdot T^2 \right)$$ NEE nighttime NEE, , ecosystem respiration (\(\mu\)mol CO2 m-2 s-1), TA air temperature (°C), \(r_0\) ecosystem respiration TA = 0 °C, alpha beta coefficients. equation requires air temperature (TA) degrees Celsius, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1, net ecosystem exchange (NEE) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_02
code: TRC_PARMS_02(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.trc = brms::prior("normal(1, 5)", nlpar = "r0", lb = 0, ub = 5) +     brms::prior("normal(0.07, 0.1)", nlpar = "alpha", lb = 0, ub = 0.2) +     brms::prior("normal(0, 0.05)", nlpar = "beta", lb = -0.1, ub = 0.1),   idx.colname = NULL,   NEE.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL,   TA.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_02
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, air temperature (TA), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.trc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. NEE.colname (character) name column containing NEE. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR. TA.colname (character) name column containing air temperature.
code: brms::prior("normal(1, 5)", nlpar = "r0", lb = 0, ub = 5) + brms::prior("normal(0.07, 0.1)", nlpar = "alpha", lb = 0, ub = 0.2) + brms::prior("normal(0, 0.05)", nlpar = "beta", lb = -0.1, ub = 0.1)

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_02
text: (dataframe) Dataframe parameter values index used fit .

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_02
text: Model parameters fit using R package brms. Rhat (Potential Scale Reduction Factor): Indicates well different Markov chains analysis converged posterior distribution. Ideally, Rhat close 1 parameters. high Rhat value suggests potential convergence issues need run chains longer. Bulk ESS (Effective Sample Size - Bulk): Estimates effective number independent samples central part posterior distribution. Tail ESS (Effective Sample Size - Tail): Estimates effective number independent samples tails posterior distribution. Important assessing reliability quantile estimates (e.g., 95% confidence intervals). Key points remember: Aim Rhat close 1 high values Bulk ESS Tail ESS.

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_02
code: # Write examples here

what: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_03
title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_03
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim \left( T - T_{\text{opt}} \right)^2 + E_{\text{Rmax}}$$ \(\) = parameter estimate fitted quadratic function, \(T\) = temperature Celsius, \(T_{opt}\) = optimum temperature, parameter, vertex parabola, \(E_{Rmax}\) = maximum respiration, parameter, vertex parabola. Reference: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41559-023-02121-w#Equ1 equation requires air temperature (TA) degrees Celsius, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1, net ecosystem exchange (NEE) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_03
code: TRC_PARMS_03(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.trc = brms::prior("normal(0.08, 0.03)", nlpar = "a", lb = 0, ub = 0.9) +     brms::prior("normal(24, 4)", nlpar = "Topt", lb = 10, ub = 40) +     brms::prior("normal(3.8, 5)", nlpar = "ERmax", lb = 0, ub = 10),   idx.colname = NULL,   NEE.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL,   TA.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_03
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, air temperature (TA), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.trc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. NEE.colname (character) name column containing NEE. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR. TA.colname (character) name column containing air temperature.
code: brms::prior("normal(0.08, 0.03)", nlpar = "a", lb = 0, ub = 0.9) + brms::prior("normal(24, 4)", nlpar = "Topt", lb = 10, ub = 40) + brms::prior("normal(3.8, 5)", nlpar = "ERmax", lb = 0, ub = 10)

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_03
text: (dataframe) Dataframe parameter values index used fit .

what: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_04
title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_04
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim R_{\text{ref}} \cdot Q_{10} \cdot \exp \left( \frac{T - T_{\text{ref}}}{10} \right)$$ equation requires air temperature (TA) degrees Celsius, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1, net ecosystem exchange (NEE) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_04
code: TRC_PARMS_04(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.trc = brms::prior("normal(2.0, 0.3)", nlpar = "Q10", lb = 1, ub = 3.5) +     brms::prior("normal(0.5, 0.3)", nlpar = "Rref", lb = 0.01, ub = 1),   idx.colname = NULL,   NEE.colname = NULL,   TA.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_04
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, air temperature (TA), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.trc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. NEE.colname (character) name column containing NEE. TA.colname (character) name column containing air temperature. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR.
code: brms::prior("normal(2.0, 0.3)", nlpar = "Q10", lb = 1.0, ub = 3.5) + brms::prior("normal(0.5, 0.3)", nlpar = "Rref", lb = 0.01, ub = 1)

what: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_05
title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_05
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim * \exp \left(b*T\right)$$ equation requires air temperature (TA) degrees Celsius, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1, net ecosystem exchange (NEE) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_05
code: TRC_PARMS_05(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.trc = brms::prior("normal(0.2 , 1)", nlpar = "a", lb = 0.1, ub = 1) +     brms::prior("normal(0.5, 0.03)", nlpar = "b", lb = 0.001, ub = 0.9),   idx.colname = NULL,   NEE.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL,   TA.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_05
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, air temperature (TA), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.trc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. NEE.colname (character) name column containing NEE. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR. TA.colname (character) name column containing air temperature.
code: brms::prior("normal(0.2, 1)", nlpar = "a", lb = 0.1, ub = 1) + brms::prior("normal(0.5, 0.03)", nlpar = "b", lb = 0.001, ub = 0.9)

what: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_06
title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_06
text: function uses equation: $$\text{NEE} \sim R_{\text{ref}} \cdot \exp \left( \frac{E_a}{R} \left( \frac{1}{T_{\text{ref}}} - \frac{1}{T} \right) \right) $$ \(R_{ref}\) reference respiration rate [\(\mu\)mol CO2 m-2 s-1], \(E_a\) activation energy [J/mol], \(R\) Universal Gas Constant [8.314 J mol-1 K-1], \(T_{ref}\) reference temperature (25 C 298K) [K], TA temperature [K]. WARNING: TA must kelvin. equation requires air temperature (TA) kelvin, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1, net ecosystem exchange (NEE) \(\mu\)mol m-2 s-1.

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_06
code: TRC_PARMS_06(   data.frame = NULL,   iterations = NULL,   priors.trc = brms::prior("normal(0.5, 0.3)", nlpar = "Ea", lb = 0.01, ub = 1) +     brms::prior("normal(.5, .3)", nlpar = "Rref", lb = 0.01, ub = 1),   idx.colname = NULL,   NEE.colname = NULL,   PAR.colname = NULL,   TA.colname = NULL )

title: Fit a Temperature Response Curve (TRC) by an index to get a parameter file — TRC_PARMS_06
text: data.frame (dataframe) dataframe contains net ecosystem exchange (NEE), index, air temperature (TA), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). iterations (numeric) number iterations run brms::brm(). priors.trc (brmsprior dataframe) priors brms::brm() use. Default priors follows:   idx.colname (character) name column containing index. NEE.colname (character) name column containing NEE. PAR.colname (character) name column containing PAR. TA.colname (character) name column containing air temperature.
code: brms::prior("normal(0.5, 0.3)", nlpar = "Ea", lb = 0.01, ub = 1) + brms::prior("normal(.5, .3)", nlpar = "Rref", lb = 0.01, ub = 1)

text: (dataframe) Dataframe parameter values index used fit .
